source.5696da56: data['Company Name'] = data['Company Name'].apply(lambda x: re.sub(r'\n.*','',str(x)))
source.4b987730:
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns
source.c1cb9e6c:
fig = px.scatter(data, x="Rating", y="Company Name", 
                 color="Rating", 
                 hover_data=['Headquarters','Location', 'Type of ownership', 'Industry', 'Sector'], 
                 title = "Data Analyst jobs")
fig.show()
source.1ad6a07e:
import plotly.graph_objects as go
fig2 = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter(
    y = data['Location'],
    mode='markers',
    marker=dict(
        size=16,
        color=data['Rating'], #set color equal to a variable
        colorscale='Viridis', # one of plotly colorscales
        showscale=True
    )
))
fig2.update_layout(title='Data Analyst Jobs',
                  yaxis_title="Location")
fig2.show()
source.0eba13a7:
fig2 = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter(x=data['Headquarters'],
                                y=data['Company Name'],
                                mode='markers',
                                marker_color=data['Rating'],
                                )) 
fig2.update_layout(title='Data Analyst Jobs',
                  xaxis_title="Headquaters",
                  yaxis_title="Company Name")
fig2.show()
source.e6b7ac53: Info method shows that there are no null value but if we observe the dataset heading and tail we will come to know that instead of null value they have put -1 so lets do one thing we will replace -1 with np.nan so we can calculate the missing values in dataset for better observation.

source.bd8b81fa: In Company Column we can see that data have \n3.8 as suffix where 3.8 is rating of company and we will eliminate this and only keep the Company name in that column because we already have a seprate Rating Column.

* Job Title
* Salary Estimate

source.71f3e532:
Job Description Column have huge amount of text data which is not required for this EDA so we will drop this column (But we will use this in next Version)

And we also know that If a Person is Appointed as Data Analyst or for any Job Role then he or she must have great idea about that role
source.bac385c8:
In this notebook, I analyze the dataset and then I visualize the dataset. In this dataset as we can see there are different countries having Data Analyst Jobs. So we analyze the dataset for perfect visualizatin. The dataset has following colmns :
*     Unnamed: 0        
*     Job Title         
*     Salary Estimate    
*    Job Description    
*     Rating            
*     Company Name  
*     Location          
*     Headquarters      
*     Size               
*    Founded           
*    Type of ownership  
*   Industry            
*    Sector           
*    Revenue            
*    Competitors        
*    Easy Apply
source.b4a13dfc:
96.45% or 2173 values are Missing in Easy Apply Column

76.88% or 1732 values are Missing in Competitors Column

There are more than 50% values are missing in these 2 Column

so we will simply drop the Column becaue there are not enough data to do Forward,Backward, Mean, Median , Mode or Imputer Fill
